If you were in promos a number of times within a short period your MMR becomes extremely high and means that the system skips you.

e.g: if you're on 90 pt's then win one at 25 (mmr = 90+25), then you win another and lose two (+25-(15*2)).
So atm your MMR is 110 (already too high for B5)

if this happens 3 times it's enough to skip you 1 Division. I've also noticed if you've had a huge amount of wins in norms (around 10 in a row) then win in ranked I got ~35LP per ranked win. which gives you an even higher chance of jumping tiers. (I'm well aware that they are not mutually exclusive, IT'S JUST A FUCKING OBSERVATION)

I got fed up at one point of being in promos for silver then going all the way back to b3 that I just played norms with my mates, at one point getting 15 wins in a row that when the preseason started I was getting between 30 and 36 points per ranked win. Got all the way though to S3 in a month using mundo xin and jax mostly (before they got perma banned)

BTW while oce.op.gg is a good site for information I like to compare to lolking.net and lol-mmr.com as well. lolking gives you a trend of champion win rates and stats, while lol-mmr gives you a projection of your MMR and a you vs other MMR stats. It also has a nice tool that shows you a run down of previous games

I guess you are meaning LP here, not MMR. **MMR is the hidden matchmaking rating that everyone has so that they get matched against opponents of the same skill level.** It changes depending on wins and losses, and it is the thing that determines LP gains. 

* More wins than losses = higher LP gain for a win and losing not as much for a loss. 
* More losses than wins = less LP gain for a win and losing quite a bit per loss. If you are consistently 
* It also slightly adjusts for when you go on tilt (even if you have more wins than losses overall, if you tilt your MMR & LP gains go into losses>wins), and vice versa for when you are on a winning streak. 

If you are consistently winning games and have an overall greater number of wins than losses, your MMR may inflate above your current ranked standing. If it sits 2-3 divisions above where you are and manages to stay that way for a while, you will skip divisions once having successfully completed a series _(it is still a pretty rare occurrence and only happens below plat)_.
> 
> I've also noticed if you've had a huge amount of wins in norms (around 10 in a row) then win in ranked you get ~35LP per ranked win. which gives you an even higher chance of jumping tiers.

[Normal wins have absolutely nothing to do with ranked and any LP gains or ranked MMR.](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/1iydwv/clarification_on_normal_games_effect_on_placement/)
